metadata.synopsis: Wyll appears at camp to confront Karlach, if she was recruited first or is avatar and met Wyll.

72.context: CinematicNodeContext: The party enters camp, and Wyll walks out of the shadows or otherwise appears in a surprising way. He holds his starting blade in his hand.

295.speaker: Narrator
295.text: *You have a flash of recognition. This is the Blade of Frontiers - hero of the Sword Coast, and the hunter who chased you through the Hells.*

327.speaker: Karlach
327.text: I figured you'd show up. The Blade of Frontiers is a man of his word.

59.speaker: Wyll
59.text: Then I live up to my repute. And you -

345.speaker: Karlach
345.text: Ah, the legend lives. I figured you'd show up eventually.

347.speaker: Karlach
347.text: Give it up already, I'm not the monster you think I am.

122.speaker: Wyll
122.text: I know exactly what you are. Zariel's -

45.speaker: Karlach
45.text: It's about time. Shall I put the kettle on?

31.speaker: Wyll
31.text: The devil's way, isn't it? So casually cruel. I -

165.speaker: Narrator
165.text: *A great fire roars through you - the fire of the Hells you've escaped.*
165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

151.speaker: Narrator
151.text: *You are the Blade of Frontiers, racing through the wastes of Avernus. Just ahead, a familiar figure - red skin, single curled horn - blazes with flame, bloodied greataxe held high.*
151.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

263.speaker: Narrator
263.text: *He chases you across the Hells' battlefields, ignited with rancour. He sees you as an infernal wardevil, a threat to the living - evil incarnate.*
263.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

142.speaker: Wyll
142.text: Infernal soldier, Zariel's lickspittle. I will not let you burn the Sword Coast to ash.

229.speaker: Karlach
229.text: I'm not going to hurt anyone, and I'm certainly no devil.

258.speaker: Wyll
258.context: CinematicNodeContext: Interrupted by a vision, grips head in mindmeld.

190.speaker: Karlach
190.text: For shit's sake, you really don't know how Zariel 'recruits' her soldiers, do you?

178.speaker: Wyll
178.context: CinematicNodeContext: Interrupted by a vision, grips head in mindmeld.

262.speaker: Narrator
262.text: *He sees through your eyes. You slice through one devil after another - Zariel's servants - as your eyes dart around, seeking escape.*

137.speaker: Narrator
137.text: *The man shudders with your desperation, and sees the naked truth: you are a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*

101.speaker: Wyll
101.text: By Balduran's helm, I - no. I will not be tricked!

177.speaker: Karlach
177.text: You saw the truth. I'm not a danger to the Coast.

93.speaker: Karlach
93.text: Be practical. You're infected, same as me. You need allies, not enemies.

302.speaker: Narrator
302.text: *He catches his breath, and his lips straighten. Sheer dread twists his face.*
302.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll catches his breath, and his face hardens. Signs of worry, fear - even sheer dread.

32.speaker: Karlach
32.text: Thank the gods. I thought I was going to have to take your head.

187.speaker: Wyll
187.text: I can only hope you won't have to find out.
187.context: NodeContext: Referring to mizora. With portent

186.speaker: Gale
186.text: Stormy introduction aside, might I suggest a partnership instead? The Blade of Frontiers would make a formidable ally.

155.speaker: Karlach
155.text: Great idea. You could join up with us - find a cure for these parasites, smash some skulls.

135.speaker: Karlach
135.text: How about 'teammates'? Find a cure for these parasites, smash some skulls together.

297.speaker: Wyll
297.text: I'm up for the challenge. You've just got to make a little space.

119.speaker: Karlach
119.text: Right you are. You should remain here, for the time being.

134.speaker: Wyll
134.text: I've not grown any tentacles yet, thank Balduran - but luck won't be on our side forever.

6.speaker: Wyll
6.text: You seem like a good crew.

38.speaker: Wyll
38.text: Yes, you have my blade - not to mention, a thousand sorries.

259.speaker: Karlach
259.text: You can take Astarion's place - he'll stay here at camp.

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*

329.speaker: Karlach
329.text: Gale could do with a rest.

66.speaker: Karlach
66.text: Truce. But I think it's best if you get on your way.

41.speaker: Wyll
41.text: I see the good in you, Karlach. I promise not to lose sight of it, even when the Hells burn hottest.

319.speaker: Karlach
319.text: Get out. And don't show your face again.

296.speaker: Karlach
296.text: Ding ding ding. You got there in the end.

211.speaker: Wyll
211.text: I had my reasons to hope I was right. But I can't deny the truth.
211.context: NodeContext: Referring to mizora. With portent

339.speaker: Karlach
339.text: You're a problem. And I'm thinking violence is the solution.

251.speaker: Wyll
251.text: To the Hells with you devil - and may you forever burn.

285.speaker: Karlach
285.text: Yes, I served Zariel. But I had no bloody choice.

341.speaker: Wyll
341.text: And yet you served. I - ngh!
341.context: CinematicNodeContext: Interrupted by a vision, grips head in mindmeld.

307.speaker: Karlach
307.text: You want a fight? Let's see what the Blade can do.

338.speaker: Karlach
338.text: You better lower that blade if you know what's good for you.

108.speaker: Wyll
108.text: My blade's found its prey. Zariel's chosen -

244.context: CinematicNodeContext: The party enters camp, and Wyll walks out of the shadows or otherwise appears in a surprising way. He holds his starting blade in his hand.

156.speaker: Karlach
156.text: The Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good after the mind flayer ship. But you just can't get enough of me, can you.
156.context: NodeContext: With an edge - she's not flirting. Talking to a guy who's been pursuing her in the name of her evil mistress.

56.speaker: Wyll
56.text: One horn. The stink of Avernus. Advocatus diaboli.

210.speaker: Karlach
210.context: NodeContext: Eye-roll. Wyll calling her a devil. She's annoyed but has her charm behind it.

173.speaker: Wyll
173.text: Karlach. The archdevil Zariel's gladiator, come to burn the Sword Coast to ash.

282.speaker: Player
282.text: I thought you were waiting at the grove. What are you doing here?

261.speaker: Wyll
261.text: The parasite links us - it showed me you with the fiend. Her death is my first priority, as it has always been.

201.speaker: Wyll
201.text: Stand back. The first strike is mine.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: You've got it all wrong, Wyll. Karlach's not about to hurt anyone.

350.speaker: Karlach
350.text: Well - not counting the fuckers that need a good hurting.

322.speaker: Player
322.text: The two of you have met before, I see.

100.speaker: Karlach
100.text: If by 'met' you mean hoofing it through the Hells with this fucker on my tail.

98.speaker: Wyll
98.text: Shut it, devil - I know your kind. A heart darker than a shadow's nightmares. You'd cut a child's throat just to taste the blood.

167.speaker: Karlach
167.text: A devil? I didn't take the Blade for a fool. I'm - ngh!

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *A great fire roars through you - the fire of the First Hell.*
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

351.speaker: Narrator
351.text: *You are Karlach, tearing through demons across a blood-red landscape of fire and volcanic cinder.*
351.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

222.speaker: Narrator
222.text: *The front lines of the Blood War. With every swing of her axe, Karlach fulfils mistress Zariel's purpose.*
222.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

300.speaker: Wyll
300.text: Proof, clear as summer sky. It's over, Karlach. It's time you feel the sting of the Blade.

311.speaker: Narrator
311.text: *Wyll shudders with Karlach's desperation. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
311.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

198.speaker: Player
198.text: I captured your target, Wyll. Why don't you do the honours?

44.speaker: Wyll
44.text: Karlach. Advocatus diaboli. The stink of Avernus.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: I remember you, from the goblin fight at the grove. What do you want?

310.speaker: Wyll
310.text: The devil's head. And yours, if you so much as -

267.speaker: Player
267.text: You better lower that blade if you know what's good for you.

107.speaker: Wyll
107.text: You ally with an archdevil's chosen, and -

182.speaker: Narrator
182.text: *A great fire roars through you - the fire of the First Hell.*
182.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

169.speaker: Narrator
169.text: *You are the Blade of Frontiers, racing through the wastes of Avernus. Just ahead, a diabolical figure - red skin, single curled horn - blazes with flame, bloodied greataxe held high.*
169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

160.speaker: Narrator
160.text: *He chases the fiend, ignited with rancour. She is an infernal wardevil, a threat to the living - evil incarnate.*
160.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *You are Karlach, tearing through demons across a blood-red landscape of fire and volcanic cinder.*
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

143.speaker: Narrator
143.text: *The front lines of the Blood War. With every swing of her axe, Karlach fulfils mistress Zariel's purpose.*
143.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

314.speaker: Wyll
314.text: Your ally's a fraud - a soldier in the archdevil Zariel's army. Either I cut her down, or she burns the Sword Coast to ash.

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: I've tried to tell you - I'm not what you think I am. I'm - ngh!

245.speaker: Narrator
245.text: *Another vision. Karlach's blade raised, slicing through devils - Zariel's servants - as her eyes dart around, seeking escape.*
245.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *The man shudders with Karlach's desperation. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

80.speaker: Wyll
80.text: By Balduran's helm, I - no. I will not be tricked!
80.context: NodeContext: Questioning himself. He has learned the 'monster' he hunts is a victim, but he still ready to attack

287.speaker: Karlach
287.text: You saw the truth. I may be an effective soldier, but I never wanted to serve Zariel. Legged it away from her the first chance I got.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Stand down. You saw what I saw - Karlach is not a danger.

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: *The man catches his breath, and his lips straighten. Sheer dread twists his face.*
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll catches his breath, and his face hardens. Signs of worry, fear - even sheer dread.

180.speaker: Wyll
180.text: No. Devils can not be trusted!

215.speaker: Player
215.text: Gods, you're stubborn. Karlach's not a devil, and you know it.

278.speaker: Player
278.text: You saw Karlach's thoughts. She poses no threat to the Sword Coast.

274.speaker: Player
274.text: You're right. Let's cut her down before she causes any trouble.

117.speaker: Wyll
117.text: It's done, Karlach. By my living soul, you will forever burn.

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: You know, I could've used a few friends. Pity that won't be any of you.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: You invade my camp and threaten my friend? You're the one dying tonight.

330.speaker: Karlach
330.text: How about we all take a nice deep breath and calm the fuck down. Just cause I want to live doesn't mean I want him dead.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Fine, but he needs to stand down. We saw the truth for ourselves.

147.speaker: Karlach
147.text: Would you listen to sense? This doesn't have to end badly - for either of us.

271.speaker: Karlach
271.text: You know monsters, right? Better than anyone. Look into my eyes. Can't you see I'm not what you think?

123.speaker: Wyll
123.context: CinematicNodeContext: There's a pause, and then Wyll swears. He realises he has resigned himself to becoming a devil himself. He's upset - but he knows he did the right thing. He lowers his blade.

7.speaker: Wyll
7.text: You really are no devil, are you? I've... I've been deceived.

194.speaker: Karlach
194.text: Thank the gods. Thought I was going to have to take your head.
194.context: NodeContext: Relieved Wyll is seeing sense. Calming down from her anger.

0.speaker: Wyll
0.text: You would've died in the attempt. But - there have been enough threats today.
0.context: NodeContext: Small flare of anger again, but ultimately Wyll is calming down and realizing Karlach is an ally.

191.speaker: Wyll
191.text: I see the good in you, Karlach. I promise not to lose sight of it, even when the Hells burn hottest.

195.speaker: Wyll
195.text: I'm returning to the grove. Zevlor's people need champions.

78.speaker: Wyll
78.text: I hope he can count you in that number.

121.speaker: Karlach
121.text: I'll do you one better: allies.

37.speaker: Karlach
37.text: We're looking to get rid of these parasites for good - and ruin some bastards' days while we're at it. Sounds like your kind of venture.

249.speaker: Wyll
249.text: I've not grown any tentacles yet, thank Balduran - but luck won't be on our side forever.

136.speaker: Wyll
136.text: Yes, you have my blade - your leader willing, of course.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: The more the merrier, as they say.

48.speaker: Wyll
48.text: I'm up for the challenge. You've just got to make a little space.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Right you are. You should remain here, for the time being.

257.speaker: Player
257.text: You can take Astarion's place - he'll stay here at camp.

270.speaker: Narrator
270.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*

358.speaker: Player
358.text: Gale could do with a rest.

236.speaker: Karlach
236.text: Pfft. Everyone on this team is nothing but trouble. But I'm sure we can all agree to keep it down to a simmer.

254.speaker: Wyll
254.text: Well met. And - a thousand sorries.

57.speaker: Wyll
57.text: I've pledged my life to protecting the meek from monsters - but tonight, I was the rampaging beast.

51.speaker: Wyll
51.text: I see the good in you, Karlach. I promise not to lose sight of it, even when the Hells burn hottest.

223.speaker: Shadowheart
223.text: Hmph - the famous Blade of Frontiers, in the flesh. Clever, this hero act you've got going.

252.speaker: Wyll
252.text: 'Hero,' 'Blade' - names strangers gave me. My friends call me 'Wyll'.

131.speaker: Shadowheart
131.text: Excellent. If we ever become friends, I'll know what to call you.

303.speaker: Player
303.text: All right. But you're both out of here at the first sign of trouble.

332.speaker: Player
332.text: I'll consider it. How do I know I can trust you?

113.speaker: Wyll
113.text: Let my deeds to come prove my worth.

279.speaker: Player
279.text: Not on your life. I want him out of here.

95.speaker: Wyll
95.text: Fair is fair. Tonight, I lost the right to be called 'hero'.

344.speaker: Wyll
344.text: I see the good in you, Karlach. I promise not to lose sight of it, even when the Hells burn hottest.

315.speaker: Player
315.text: But I do. The Blade of Frontiers will be only a memory come tomorrow.

298.speaker: Wyll
298.text: To the Hells with you, then - and may you all forever burn.

352.speaker: Player
352.text: Be practical. You're infected, same as us. You need allies, not enemies.

269.speaker: Player
269.text: I never did trust you, Karlach. You're as good as dead.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: The only one dying tonight's the Blade of Frontiers.

230.speaker: Player
230.text: Fine, but he needs to stand down. We saw the truth for ourselves.

277.speaker: Player
277.text: 'The Blade of Frontiers'. Did I hear that right?

171.speaker: Player
171.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast. Have I got that right?

140.speaker: Wyll
140.text: Pride of the Coast, in the flesh. And you've got -

179.speaker: Player
179.text: The hero from the druid's grove. What do you want?

170.speaker: Player
170.text: You better lower that blade if you know what's good for you.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: You two know each other, I see.

293.speaker: Karlach
293.text: Like a hammer knows an untouchable nail. Look, I'm not -
